  "patch": "@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@ ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n \n # Configure custom domains with Microsoft Entra application proxy\n \n-When you publish an application through Microsoft Entra application proxy, you create an external URL for your users. This URL gets the default domain *`yourtenant.msappproxy.net`*. For example, if you publish an app named *Expenses* in your tenant named *Contoso*, the external URL is *`https:\\//expenses-contoso.msappproxy.net`*. If you want to use your own domain name instead of *`msappproxy.net`*, you can configure a custom domain for your application. \n+When you publish an application through Microsoft Entra application proxy, you create an external URL for your users. This URL gets the default domain *`yourtenant.msappproxy.net`*. For example, if you publish an app named *Expenses* in your tenant named *Contoso*, the external URL is *`https://expenses-contoso.msappproxy.net`*. If you want to use your own domain name instead of *`msappproxy.net`*, you can configure a custom domain for your application. \n \n ## Benefits of custom domains\n "
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
This commit modifies a Markdown file related to configuring custom domains with Microsoft Entra application proxy.

The change primarily updates the example of an external URL generated by the application proxy. It replaces the `\\//` with a single `/` in the example URL, making it more standard and readable. This ensures the documentation provides a clear and accurate representation of the default external URL format.

    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@\n+---\n+title: Check web content filtering categories\n+description: Use the web category checker to find which web content category a URL belongs to via Microsoft Graph.\n+author: fgomulka\n+ms.author: frankgomulka\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.service: global-secure-access\n+ms.date: 08/28/2025\n+ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n+ai-usage: ai-assisted\n+---\n+\n+# Check web categories with the web category checker tool\n+\n+The article shows how to use the web category checker tool to determine which content category a given Uniform Resource Locator (URL) belongs to. The tool is currently available only via Microsoft Graph API.\n+\n+## How to use the Web category checker\n+\n+1. Sign in to Graph Explorer at https://aka.ms/ge as a Global Secure Access Administrator.\n+2. Set the HTTP method to **GET** and the API version to **beta**.\n+3. Use the following request format, replacing example.com with the host/path you want to check (for example, `msn.com/en-us/sports`):\n+\n+```http\n+GET https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/networkaccess/connectivity/microsoft.graph.networkaccess.getWebCategoryByUrl(url='@url')?@url=example.com\n+```\n+\n+Example:\n+\n+```http\n+GET hhttps://graph.microsoft.com/beta/networkaccess/connectivity/microsoft.graph.networkaccess.getWebCategoryByUrl(url='@url')?@url=msn.com/en-us/sports\n+```\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> - If the URL contains characters that need encoding (for example, spaces or query strings), URL-encode the `@url` value.\n+> - The feature is API-only at the moment; there's no UI in the Microsoft Entra admin center for this feature.\n+\n+## Responses\n+\n+- 200 OK  The API returns JSON containing category information for the supplied URL. Example (illustrative):\n+\n+```json\n+{\n+    \"@odata.context\": \"https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/$metadata#microsoft.graph.networkaccess.webCategory\",\n+    \"name\": \"Sports\",\n+    \"displayName\": \"Sports\",\n+    \"group\": \"GeneralSurfing\"\n+}\n+```\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- Use the category value to validate or create network access rules and policies.\n+- Verify possible [web categories](reference-web-content-filtering-categories.md)"
  },

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/b1772664f37c7db5cad5125016b2bad841d5d0aa/docs%2Fidentity%2Fsaas-apps%2Fgithub-ae-provisioning-tutorial.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b1772664f37c7db5cad5125016b2bad841d5d0aa/docs%2Fidentity%2Fsaas-apps%2Fgithub-ae-provisioning-tutorial.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fsaas-apps%2Fgithub-ae-provisioning-tutorial.md?ref=b1772664f37c7db5cad5125016b2bad841d5d0aa",
    "patch": "@@ -1,152 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Configure GitHub AE for automatic user provisioning with Microsoft Entra ID\n-description: Learn how to automatically provision and de-provision user accounts from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub AE.\n-\n-\n-author: jeevansd\n-manager: pmwongera\n-\n-ms.service: entra-id\n-ms.subservice: saas-apps\n-\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 03/25/2025\n-ms.author: jeedes\n-\n-# Customer intent: As an IT administrator, I want to learn how to automatically provision and deprovision user accounts from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub AE so that I can streamline the user management process and ensure that users have the appropriate access to GitHub AE.\n----\n-\n-# Configure GitHub AE for automatic user provisioning with Microsoft Entra ID\n-\n-This article describes the steps you need to perform in both GitHub AE and Microsoft Entra ID to configure automatic user provisioning. When configured, Microsoft Entra ID automatically provisions and de-provisions users and/or groups to GitHub AE using the Microsoft Entra provisioning service. For important details on what this service does, how it works, and frequently asked questions, see [Automate user provisioning and deprovisioning to SaaS applications with Microsoft Entra ID](~/identity/app-provisioning/user-provisioning.md). \n-\n-\n-## Capabilities supported\n-> [!div class=\"checklist\"]\n-> * Create users in GitHub AE\n-> * Remove users in GitHub AE when they don't require access anymore\n-> * Keep user attributes synchronized between Microsoft Entra ID and GitHub AE\n-> * Provision groups and group memberships in GitHub AE\n-> * Single sign-on to [GitHub AE](./github-ae-tutorial.md) (recommended)\n-\n-## Prerequisites\n-\n-The scenario outlined in this article assumes that you already have the following prerequisites:\n-\n-[!INCLUDE [common-prerequisites.md](~/identity/saas-apps/includes/common-prerequisites.md)]\n-* GitHub AE, fully [initialized](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/configuration/initializing-github-ae) and configured for login with [SAML SSO](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/authentication/configuring-authentication-and-provisioning-for-your-enterprise-using-azure-ad) through your Microsoft Entra tenant.\n-\n-## Step 1: Plan your provisioning deployment\n-1. Learn about [how the provisioning service works](~/identity/app-provisioning/user-provisioning.md).\n-2. Determine who's in [scope for provisioning](~/identity/app-provisioning/define-conditional-rules-for-provisioning-user-accounts.md).\n-3. Determine what data to [map between Microsoft Entra ID and GitHub AE](~/identity/app-provisioning/customize-application-attributes.md). \n-\n-<a name='step-2-configure-github-ae-to-support-provisioning-with-azure-ad'></a>\n-\n-## Step 2: Configure GitHub AE to support provisioning with Microsoft Entra ID\n-\n-Learn how to enable provisioning for GitHub AE [here](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/authentication/configuring-user-provisioning-for-your-enterprise).\n-\n-<a name='step-3-add-github-ae-from-the-azure-ad-application-gallery'></a>\n-\n-## Step 3: Add GitHub AE from the Microsoft Entra application gallery\n-\n-Add GitHub AE from the Microsoft Entra application gallery to start managing provisioning to GitHub AE. If you have previously setup GitHub AE for SSO, you can use the same application. However, we recommend that you create a separate app when testing out the integration initially. Learn more about adding an application from the gallery [here](~/identity/enterprise-apps/add-application-portal.md). \n-\n-## Step 4: Define who is in scope for provisioning \n-\n-[!INCLUDE [create-assign-users-provisioning.md](~/identity/saas-apps/includes/create-assign-users-provisioning.md)]\n-\n-## Step 5: Configure automatic user provisioning to GitHub AE \n-\n-This section guides you through the steps to configure the Microsoft Entra provisioning service to create, update, and disable users and/or groups in TestApp based on user and/or group assignments in Microsoft Entra ID.\n-\n-<a name='to-configure-automatic-user-provisioning-for-github-ae-in-azure-ad'></a>\n-\n-### To configure automatic user provisioning for GitHub AE in Microsoft Entra ID:\n-\n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Cloud Application Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#cloud-application-administrator).\n-1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Enterprise apps**\n-\n-\t![Enterprise applications blade](common/enterprise-applications.png)\n-\n-1. In the applications list, select **GitHub AE**.\n-\n-\t![The GitHub AE link in the Applications list](common/all-applications.png)\n-\n-3. Select the **Provisioning** tab.\n-\n-\t![Provisioning tab](common/provisioning.png)\n-\n-4. Set the **Provisioning Mode** to **Automatic**.\n-\n-\t![Provisioning tab automatic](common/provisioning-automatic.png)\n-\n-5. Under the **Admin Credentials** section, input your GitHub AE **Tenant URL** and **Secret Token** retrieved earlier from Step 2. Select **Test Connection** to ensure Microsoft Entra ID can connect to GitHub AE. If the connection fails, ensure your GitHub AE account has Admin permissions and try again.\n-\n-\t![Token](common/provisioning-testconnection-tenanturltoken.png)\n-\n-6. In the **Notification Email** field, enter the email address of a person or group who should receive the provisioning error notifications and select the **Send an email notification when a failure occurs** check box.\n-\n-\t![Notification Email](common/provisioning-notification-email.png)\n-\n-7. Select **Save**.\n-\n-8. Under the **Mappings** section, select **Synchronize Microsoft Entra users** to **GitHub AE**.\n-\n-9. Review the user attributes that are synchronized from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub AE in the **Attribute-Mapping** section. The attributes selected as **Matching** properties are used to match the user accounts in GitHub AE for update operations. If you choose to change the [matching target attribute](~/identity/app-provisioning/customize-application-attributes.md), you need to ensure that the GitHub AE API supports filtering users based on that attribute. Select the **Save** button to commit any changes.\n-\n-   |Attribute|Type|\n-   |---|---|\n-   |userName|String|\n-   |externalId|String|\n-   |emails[type eq \"work\"].value|String|\n-   |active|Boolean|\n-   |name.givenName|String|\n-   |name.familyName|String|\n-   |name.formatted|String|\n-   |displayName|String|\n-\n-10. Under the **Mappings** section, select **Synchronize Microsoft Entra groups to GitHub AE**.\n-\n-11. Review the group attributes that are synchronized from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub AE in the **Attribute-Mapping** section. The attributes selected as **Matching** properties are used to match the groups in GitHub AE for update operations. Select the **Save** button to commit any changes.\n-\n-      |Attribute|Type|\n-      |---|---|\n-      |displayName|String|\n-      |externalId|String|\n-      |members|Reference|\n-\n-12. To configure scoping filters, refer to the following instructions provided in the [Scoping filter  article](~/identity/app-provisioning/define-conditional-rules-for-provisioning-user-accounts.md).\n-\n-13. To enable the Microsoft Entra provisioning service for GitHub AE, change the **Provisioning Status** to **On** in the **Settings** section.\n-\n-\t![Provisioning Status Toggled On](common/provisioning-toggle-on.png)\n-\n-14. Define the users and/or groups that you would like to provision to GitHub AE by choosing the desired values in **Scope** in the **Settings** section.\n-\n-\t![Provisioning Scope](common/provisioning-scope.png)\n-\n-15. When you're ready to provision, select **Save**.\n-\n-\t![Saving Provisioning Configuration](common/provisioning-configuration-save.png)\n-\n-This operation starts the initial synchronization cycle of all users and/or groups defined in **Scope** in the **Settings** section. The initial cycle takes longer to perform than subsequent cycles, which occur approximately every 40 minutes as long as the Microsoft Entra provisioning service is running. \n-\n-## Step 6: Monitor your deployment\n-\n-[!INCLUDE [monitor-deployment.md](~/identity/saas-apps/includes/monitor-deployment.md)]\n-\n-## Change log\n-\n-* 02/18/2021 - Added support for Groups provisioning.\n-\n-## Additional resources\n-\n-* [Managing user account provisioning for Enterprise Apps](~/identity/app-provisioning/configure-automatic-user-provisioning-portal.md)\n-* [What is application access and single sign-on with Microsoft Entra ID?](~/identity/enterprise-apps/what-is-single-sign-on.md)\n-\n-## Related content\n-\n-* [Learn how to review logs and get reports on provisioning activity](~/identity/app-provisioning/check-status-user-account-provisioning.md)"
  },
  {
    "sha": "fc59f0ab9e8b292c5b6c9c521e2fed788c29b9df",
    "filename": "docs/identity/saas-apps/github-enterprise-server-provisioning-tutorial.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 153,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 153,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/caaf7d91e69ef3fd9d79b3845e84058a5ca4618c/docs%2Fidentity%2Fsaas-apps%2Fgithub-enterprise-server-provisioning-tutorial.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/caaf7d91e69ef3fd9d79b3845e84058a5ca4618c/docs%2Fidentity%2Fsaas-apps%2Fgithub-enterprise-server-provisioning-tutorial.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fsaas-apps%2Fgithub-enterprise-server-provisioning-tutorial.md?ref=caaf7d91e69ef3fd9d79b3845e84058a5ca4618c",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,153 @@\n+---\n+title: Configure GitHub Enterprise Server for Automatic User Provisioning with Microsoft Entra ID\n+description: Learn how to automatically provision and de-provision user accounts from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub Enterprise Server.\n+author: jeevansd\n+manager: mwongerapk\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.subservice: saas-apps\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 03/25/2025\n+ms.author: jeedes\n+\n+# Customer intent: As an IT administrator, I want to learn how to automatically provision and deprovision user accounts from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub Enterprise Server so that I can streamline the user management process and ensure that users have the appropriate access to GitHub Enterprise Server.\n+---\n+\n+# Configure GitHub Enterprise Server for automatic user provisioning with Microsoft Entra ID\n+\n+This article describes the steps you need to perform in both GitHub Enterprise Server and Microsoft Entra ID to configure automatic user provisioning. When configured, Microsoft Entra ID automatically provisions and de-provisions users and/or groups to GitHub Enterprise Server using the Microsoft Entra provisioning service. For important details on what this service does, how it works, and frequently asked questions, see [Automate user provisioning and deprovisioning to SaaS applications with Microsoft Entra ID](~/identity/app-provisioning/user-provisioning.md). \n+\n+\n+## Capabilities supported\n+> [!div class=\"checklist\"]\n+> * Create users in GitHub Enterprise Server\n+> * Remove users in GitHub Enterprise Server when they don't require access anymore\n+> * Keep user attributes synchronized between Microsoft Entra ID and GitHub Enterprise Server\n+> * Provision groups and group memberships in GitHub Enterprise Server\n+> * Single sign-on to [GitHub Enterprise Server](./github-enterprise-server-tutorial.md) (recommended)\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+The scenario outlined in this article assumes that you already have the following prerequisites:\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [common-prerequisites.md](~/identity/saas-apps/includes/common-prerequisites.md)]\n+* GitHub Enterprise Server, fully [initialized](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server/admin/overview/about-github-enterprise-server) and configured for login with [SAML SSO](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server/admin/managing-iam/using-saml-for-enterprise-iam/configuring-saml-single-sign-on-for-your-enterprise) through your Microsoft Entra tenant.\n+\n+## Step 1: Plan your provisioning deployment\n+1. Learn about [how the provisioning service works](~/identity/app-provisioning/user-provisioning.md).\n+1. Determine who's in [scope for provisioning](~/identity/app-provisioning/define-conditional-rules-for-provisioning-user-accounts.md).\n+1. Determine what data to [map between Microsoft Entra ID and GitHub Enterprise Server](~/identity/app-provisioning/customize-application-attributes.md). \n+\n+<a name='step-2-configure-github-server-to-support-provisioning-with-azure-ad'></a>\n+\n+## Step 2: Configure GitHub Enterprise Server to support provisioning with Microsoft Entra ID\n+\n+Learn how to enable provisioning for GitHub Enterprise Server [here](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server/admin/managing-iam/provisioning-user-accounts-with-scim/configuring-scim-provisioning-for-users).\n+\n+<a name='step-3-add-github-server-from-the-azure-ad-application-gallery'></a>\n+\n+## Step 3: Add GitHub Enterprise Server from the Microsoft Entra application gallery\n+\n+Add GitHub Enterprise Server from the Microsoft Entra application gallery to start managing provisioning to GitHub Enterprise Server. If you have previously setup GitHub Enterprise Server for SSO, you can use the same application. However, we recommend that you create a separate app when testing out the integration initially. Learn more about adding an application from the gallery [here](~/identity/enterprise-apps/add-application-portal.md). \n+\n+## Step 4: Define who is in scope for provisioning \n+\n+[!INCLUDE [create-assign-users-provisioning.md](~/identity/saas-apps/includes/create-assign-users-provisioning.md)]\n+\n+## Step 5: Configure automatic user provisioning to GitHub Enterprise Server \n+\n+This section guides you through the steps to configure the Microsoft Entra provisioning service to create, update, and disable users and/or groups in TestApp based on user and/or group assignments in Microsoft Entra ID.\n+\n+<a name='to-configure-automatic-user-provisioning-for-github-server-in-azure-ad'></a>\n+\n+### To configure automatic user provisioning for GitHub Enterprise Server in Microsoft Entra ID:\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Cloud Application Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#cloud-application-administrator).\n+1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Enterprise apps**\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the Enterprise applications blade.](common/enterprise-applications.png)\n+\n+1. In the applications list, select **GitHub Enterprise Server**.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the GitHub Enterprise Server link highlighted in the Applications list.](common/all-applications.png)\n+\n+1. Select the **Provisioning** tab.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the Provisioning tab selected in the application menu.](common/provisioning.png)\n+\n+1. Set the **Provisioning Mode** to **Automatic**.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the Provisioning Mode dropdown set to Automatic.](common/provisioning-automatic.png)\n+\n+1. Under the **Admin Credentials** section, input your GitHub Enterprise Server **Tenant URL** and **Secret Token**. The values of the fields are in the following format:\n+\n+    * **Tenant URL**: `https://<your-github-server-domain>/api/v3/scim`\n+    * **Secret Token**: [The Personal Access Token (PAT)](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server/admin/managing-iam/provisioning-user-accounts-with-scim/configuring-scim-provisioning-for-users#2-create-a-personal-access-token) you created for [the provisioning account](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server/admin/managing-iam/provisioning-user-accounts-with-scim/configuring-scim-provisioning-for-users#1-create-a-built-in-setup-user) in your GitHub Enterprise Server instance.\n+\n+    Select **Test Connection** to ensure Microsoft Entra ID can connect to GitHub Enterprise Server. If the connection fails, ensure your GitHub Enterprise Server account has Admin permissions and try again.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the tenant URL and secret token fields with a Test Connection button.](common/provisioning-testconnection-tenanturltoken.png)\n+\n+1. In the **Notification Email** field, enter the email address of a person or group who should receive the provisioning error notifications and select the **Send an email notification when a failure occurs** check box.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the Notification Email field and checkbox for email notifications.](common/provisioning-notification-email.png)\n+\n+1. Select **Save**.\n+\n+1. Under the **Mappings** section, select **Provision Microsoft Entra ID Users**.\n+\n+1. Review the user attributes that are synchronized from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub Enterprise Server in the **Attribute-Mapping** section. The attributes selected as **Matching** properties are used to match the user accounts in GitHub Enterprise Server for update operations. If you choose to change the [matching target attribute](~/identity/app-provisioning/customize-application-attributes.md), you need to ensure that the GitHub Enterprise Server API supports filtering users based on that attribute. Select the **Save** button to commit any changes.\n+\n+    |Attribute|Type|\n+    |---|---|\n+    |`userName`|String|\n+    |`externalId`|String|\n+    |`emails[type eq \"work\"].value`|String|\n+    |`active`|Boolean|\n+    |`name.givenName`|String|\n+    |`name.familyName`|String|\n+    |n`ame.formatted`|String|\n+    |`displayName`|String|\n+\n+1. Under the **Mappings** section, select **Provision Microsoft Entra ID Groups**.\n+\n+1. Review the group attributes that are synchronized from Microsoft Entra ID to GitHub Enterprise Server in the **Attribute-Mapping** section. The attributes selected as **Matching** properties are used to match the groups in GitHub Enterprise Server for update operations. Select the **Save** button to commit any changes.\n+\n+    |Attribute|Type|\n+    |---|---|\n+    |`displayName`|String|\n+    |`externalId`|String|\n+    |`members`|Reference|\n+\n+1. To configure scoping filters, refer to the following instructions provided in the [Scoping filter article](~/identity/app-provisioning/define-conditional-rules-for-provisioning-user-accounts.md).\n+\n+1. To enable the Microsoft Entra provisioning service for GitHub Enterprise Server, change the **Provisioning Status** to **On** in the **Settings** section.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the Provisioning Status toggle switched to the On position.](common/provisioning-toggle-on.png)\n+\n+1. Define the users and/or groups that you would like to provision to GitHub Enterprise Server by choosing the desired values in **Scope** in the **Settings** section.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the Provisioning Scope dropdown with available options.](common/provisioning-scope.png)\n+\n+1. When you're ready to provision, select **Save**.\n+\n+    ![Screenshot of the Save button highlighted to save the provisioning configuration.](common/provisioning-configuration-save.png)\n+\n+This operation starts the initial synchronization cycle of all users and/or groups defined in **Scope** in the **Settings** section. The initial cycle takes longer to perform than subsequent cycles, which occur approximately every 40 minutes as long as the Microsoft Entra provisioning service is running. \n+\n+## Step 6: Monitor your deployment\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [monitor-deployment.md](~/identity/saas-apps/includes/monitor-deployment.md)]\n+\n+## Change log\n+\n+* 02/18/2021 - Added support for Groups provisioning.\n+* 08/19/2025 - Updated links and mentions of \"GitHub AE\" to \"GitHub Enterprise Server\" to reflect the current product name.\n+\n+## Additional resources\n+\n+* [Managing user account provisioning for Enterprise Apps](~/identity/app-provisioning/configure-automatic-user-provisioning-portal.md)\n+* [What is application access and single sign-on with Microsoft Entra ID?](~/identity/enterprise-apps/what-is-single-sign-on.md)\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+* [Learn how to review logs and get reports on provisioning activity](~/identity/app-provisioning/check-status-user-account-provisioning.md)"

    "patch": "@@ -1,10 +1,10 @@\n ---\n-title: Configure GitHub Enterprise Server for Single sign-on with Microsoft Entra ID\n+title: Configure GitHub Enterprise Server for Single Sign-on with Microsoft Entra ID\n description: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Microsoft Entra ID and GitHub Enterprise Server.\n \n author: nguhiu\n manager: mwongerapk\n-ms.reviewer: celested\n+ms.reviewer: jomondi\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: saas-apps\n \n@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@ ms.author: gideonkiratu\n \n # Configure GitHub Enterprise Server for Single sign-on with Microsoft Entra ID\n \n-In this article,  you learn how to integrate GitHub Enterprise Server with Microsoft Entra ID. When you integrate GitHub Enterprise Server with Microsoft Entra ID, you can:\n+In this article, you learn how to integrate GitHub Enterprise Server with Microsoft Entra ID. When you integrate GitHub Enterprise Server with Microsoft Entra ID, you can:\n \n * Control in Microsoft Entra ID who has access to GitHub Enterprise Server.\n * Enable your users to be automatically signed-in to GitHub Enterprise Server with their Microsoft Entra accounts.\n@@ -28,19 +28,19 @@ In this article,  you learn how to integrate GitHub Enterprise Server with Micro\n To get started, you need the following items:\n \n * A Microsoft Entra subscription. If you don't have a subscription, you can get a [free account](https://azure.microsoft.com/free/).\n-* GitHub Enterprise Server, ready for [initialization](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/configuration/initializing-github-ae).\n+* GitHub Enterprise Server, ready for [initialization](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server/admin/overview/about-github-enterprise-server).\n * Along with Cloud Application Administrator, Application Administrator can also add or manage applications in Microsoft Entra ID.\n For more information, see [Azure built-in roles](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md).\n \n ## Scenario description\n \n-In this article,  you configure and test Microsoft Entra SSO in a test environment.\n+In this article, you configure and test Microsoft Entra SSO in a test environment.\n \n * GitHub Enterprise Server supports **SP** and **IDP** initiated SSO.\n * GitHub Enterprise Server supports **Just In Time** user provisioning.\n-* GitHub Enterprise Server supports [Automated user provisioning](github-ae-provisioning-tutorial.md).\n+* GitHub Enterprise Server supports [Automated user provisioning](./github-enterprise-server-provisioning-tutorial.md).\n \n-## Adding GitHub Enterprise Server from the gallery\n+## Add GitHub Enterprise Server from the gallery\n \n To configure the integration of GitHub Enterprise Server into Microsoft Entra ID, you need to add GitHub Enterprise Server from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.\n \n@@ -92,51 +92,48 @@ Follow these steps to enable Microsoft Entra SSO.\n      In the **Sign on URL** text box, type a URL using the following pattern:\n     `https://<YOUR-GITHUB-ENTERPRISE-SERVER-HOSTNAME>/sso`\n \n-\t> [!NOTE]\n-\t> These values aren't real. Update these values with the actual Identifier, Reply URL and Sign on URL. Contact [GitHub Enterprise Server Client support team](mailto:support@github.com) to get these values. You can also refer to the patterns shown in the **Basic SAML Configuration** section.\n+    > [!NOTE]\n+    > These values aren't real. Update these values with the actual Identifier, Reply URL and Sign on URL. Contact [GitHub Enterprise Server Client support team](mailto:support@github.com) to get these values. You can also refer to the patterns shown in the **Basic SAML Configuration** section.\n \n 1. GitHub Enterprise Server application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your SAML token attributes configuration. The following screenshot shows the list of default attributes.\n \n-\t![Screenshot shows the image of Enterprise Server application.](common/default-attributes.png \"Attributes\")\n+    ![Screenshot shows the image of Enterprise Server application.](common/default-attributes.png \"Attributes\")\n \n 1. Edit **User Attributes & Claims**.\n \n-1. Select **Add new claim** and enter the name as **administrator** in the textbox (the **administrator** value is case-sensitive).\n+1. Select **Add new claim** and enter the name as `administrator` in the textbox (the `administrator` value is case-sensitive).\n \n 1. Expand **Claim conditions** and select **Members** from **User type**.\n \n 1. Select **Select groups** and search for the **Group** you want to include this claim, where its members should be administrators for GHES.\n \n-1. Select **Attribute** for **Source** and enter **true** (without quotes) for the **Value**. \n+1. Select **Attribute** for **Source** and enter `true` (without quotes) for the **Value**. \n \n 1. Select **Save**.\n \n     ![Screenshot shows to manage claim for attributes.](./media/github-ae-tutorial/administrator.png \"Claims\")\n \n-    > [!NOTE]\n-    > To know the instructions on how to add a claim, please follow the [link](https://docs.github.com/en/github-ae@latest/admin/authentication/configuring-authentication-and-provisioning-for-your-enterprise-using-azure-ad).\n-\n 1. On the **Set up single sign-on with SAML** page, in the **SAML Signing Certificate** section,  find **Certificate (Base64)** and select **Download** to download the certificate and save it on your computer.\n \n-\t![Screenshot shows the Certificate download link.](common/certificatebase64.png \"Certificate\")\n+    ![Screenshot shows the Certificate download link.](common/certificatebase64.png \"Certificate\")\n \n 1. On the **Set up GitHub Enterprise Server** section, copy the appropriate URL(s) based on your requirement.\n \n-\t![Screenshot shows to copy appropriate configuration U R L.](common/copy-configuration-urls.png \"Metadata\")\n+    ![Screenshot shows to copy appropriate configuration U R L.](common/copy-configuration-urls.png \"Metadata\")\n \n <a name='create-an-azure-ad-test-user'></a>\n \n [!INCLUDE [create-assign-users-sso.md](~/identity/saas-apps/includes/create-assign-users-sso.md)]\n \n ## Configure GitHub Enterprise Server SSO\n \n-To configure SSO on GitHub Enterprise Server side, you need to follow the instructions mentioned [here](https://docs.github.com/github-ae@latest/admin/authentication/configuring-saml-single-sign-on-for-your-enterprise#enabling-saml-sso).\n+To configure SSO on GitHub Enterprise Server side, you need to follow the instructions mentioned [here](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server/admin/managing-iam/using-saml-for-enterprise-iam/configuring-saml-single-sign-on-for-your-enterprise).\n \n ### Create GitHub Enterprise Server test user\n \n In this section, a user called B.Simon is created in GitHub Enterprise Server. GitHub Enterprise Server supports just-in-time user provisioning, which is enabled by default. There's no action item for you in this section. If a user doesn't already exist in GitHub Enterprise Server, a new one is created after authentication.\n \n-GitHub Enterprise Server also supports automatic user provisioning, you can find more details [here](./github-ae-provisioning-tutorial.md) on how to configure automatic user provisioning.\n+GitHub Enterprise Server also supports automatic user provisioning. Session control extends from Conditional Access. ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces a new document detailing how to use Microsoft Graph to check web content filtering categories for Global Secure Access. It also renames and updates documentation related to GitHub Enterprise Server, including its single sign-on and provisioning tutorials, aligning with product name changes and adding new redirects. Several other documents have minor updates, including date changes, additions of service/subservice tags, and minor text adjustments.

ai_summary.Response: These commits primarily update metadata across various Microsoft Entra ID documentation pages. The key change is the consistent addition of `ms.subservice: workforce` to a wide range of articles, including primers, developer guides, tutorials, and scenario-specific pages. This adjustment likely categorises or tags these documents more accurately within the broader Microsoft Entra product suite, potentially for better organisation or searchability. Additionally, a minor correction was made to an example query in the dynamic membership documentation to refine the `deviceOSType` attribute for iOS devices.

    "patch": "@@ -30,6 +30,9 @@ sections:\n           - Define a TLS policy: Configure a TLS inspection policy that aligns with your organization's security and operational requirements.\n           - Configure Conditional Access: Create a Conditional Access policy and associate it with the Global Secure Access security profile linked to the TLS policy.\n           - Distribute the trusted certificate: Ensure the selected certificate authority is installed on all client devices to establish trust and enable seamless TLS inspection.\n+          \n+      - question: What are the cryptographic algorithms required when generating Certificates for TLS inspection? \n+        answer: Global Secure Access currently supports SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512 for the signing certificates.\n         \n       - question: How do I Sign CSR Using the Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS)\n         answer: |\n@@ -38,7 +41,6 @@ sections:\n           ```cmd\n           certreq -submit -attrib \"CertificateTemplate:SubCA\" \"C:\\pathtoyourCSR\\tlsca.csr\" \"tlsca.cer\"\n           ```\n-\n       - question: Why do I receive the error \"SSL certificate problem unable to get local issuer certificate\" when using Git?\n         answer: | \n           This error occurs because certain developer tools (such as Git) don't use the operating system's certificate store by default; instead, they maintain their own certificate store.\n@@ -94,4 +96,4 @@ additionalContent: |\n     ## Related content\n \n     * [What is Transport Layer Security inspection?](concept-transport-layer-security.md)\n-    * [Configure Transport Layer Security](how-to-transport-layer-security.md)\n\\ No newline at end of file\n+    * [Configure Transport Layer Security](how-to-transport-layer-security.md)"

ai_summary.Response:
The documentation for Microsoft Entra External ID has been updated to include information on regional opt-in for MFA telephony verification in August 2025. Several existing articles have also seen updates, with a focus on new videos, API changes, and general availability announcements for features like SAML/WS-Fed federation.

Additionally, the FAQ for Global Secure Access has been clarified to specify the required cryptographic algorithms for TLS inspection certificates, supporting SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512.

Finally, an update to the Microsoft Entra ID Governance documentation clarifies that the execution user scope list displays all users meeting the conditions, regardless of whether they have already been processed by the workflow.

ai_summary.Response: The commit modifies a documentation page regarding checking workflow execution scope in Microsoft Entra ID. It clarifies that the displayed list of users under the execution scope includes all users meeting the criteria, regardless of whether they have already been processed by the workflow. Additionally, a note is updated to emphasize that the workflow engine evaluates users irrespective of prior processing, and the results' timeliness depends on recent changes to execution conditions or user attributes.
